title: How to find internships on your own?
content:
Just like job search portals, is there **something that works well for finding internships**.

While I was searching on Google about this, I came across sites like Internshala and cuvette. I found mixed feedback/reviews about them.

What is the most reliable way to search for an internship and are they paid, if yes, how much do they charge?

comments.body: Internshala is a great place to find internships
Linkedin, Naukuri and other job platforms. **Remember Don't pay money for internships.** Some companies will ask money saying they offer course with internship. Don't believe them.
I usually recommend to LinkedIn and Google job listings. Once you find a posting by a company, I open up their career page and find other roles which aren't indexed by Google.

For jobs or internships, u can use websites like wellfound and Bluelearn. Both are good if u are looking for roles in startups or some small companies. for larger companies, apply via careers site / Linkedin, but beware of easy apply,
Its like a feature where, only if u are within the top 100 to click that button, ur resume will be seen else there is no point of that easy apply.
